hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Contraction Breakout with Volume Surge
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC's 10-day historical volatility drops below its 30-day historical volatility (volatility contraction) and is in the lowest 30th percentile over the past 90 days, and then price breaks above the 20-day high accompanied by volume > 150% of 20-day average, a sustained trend emerges over the next 10-20 days, effective across all regimes except STRESS.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Volatility contraction often precedes significant expansion (trend). Low volatility indicates coiled sentiment. High-volume breakout confirms institutional participation and direction. Works in BEAR regimes for counter-trend rallies, and BULL/NEUTRAL for continuation.
entry_conditions: BTC price breaks above 20-day high (intraday or close)
Breakout day volume > 150% of 20-day average volume

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price closes back below the 20-day breakout level

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Median 10-day forward return after signal is not statistically greater than median 10-day forward return from random days, or more than 40% of breakouts fail (close back below level within 5 days).
